str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To disturb, agitate, stir up, trouble. Of uncertain affinity; to stir or agitate.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To be of good courage, good cheer, be bold. From tharsos; to have courage.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.
